alert.note: Alert for Saint John; Saint Thomas (Virgin Islands) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 06 at 4:32AM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM AST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portion of the northern U.S.Virgin Islands, including Saint John and Saint Thomas. * WHEN...Until 730 AM AST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry guts. Water over roadways and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 432 AM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms which continue to develop and move across these areas. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Estimated amounts between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result continued in minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
